hanzi-su-wiki:
鎌

Значения

Серп

Мнемоника

Серп из металла 金. Срезает взятые рукой вместе 兼 колосья.

Варианты

镰, 鐮
purpleculture_pinyin:
lián
variant of 鐮 |镰 , scythe; sickle
вариант серпа, косы; серпа
rtega_mnemonic:
劆劆RS
镰镰		鎌劆sickle, scythe, trick
  • metal 金 tool to cut grain 兼 for storage in the silo 廉
heisig_constituent: sickle, metal, gold, concurrently, animal horns, rake
koohiiStory1: This is a special sickle with metal blades on both sides. It can cut many things concurrently!
koohiiStory2: The gold sickle of the USSR flag represents both leaders and workers laboring concurrently.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You cast the Mona Lisa in gold and attach it to a stick to turn it into a sickle! It's really big and bulky, but when you swing it fast enough your new sickle cuts lots of wheat! Just don't tell anyone what you did with the famous Mona Lisa painting and you should be able to get away with this!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine wielding your gold Mona Lisa sickle. It's sooo heavy, but it's really shiny and it cuts grass and wheat pretty well!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Now that you've turned the Mona Lisa into a sickle, you have to change the little description under its name in the Louvre. You draw a giant comma (かま) next to "Mona Lisa" and write "THE SICKLE." Then you shove it back on the wall as best you can.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hear all the guests say, "Mona Lisa... comma the sickle? WHAT'S HAPPENED HERE?!" As panic ensues. You like your addition and you're very proud.
Ru_Radicals: 丶 (капля), ノ, ハ, 并, ヨ, 王 (монарх), 金 (золото)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: double (兼) the gold (金) could buy a sickle

鎌字的基本解释

鎌
lián
同“镰”。

鎌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lián］
［《廣韻》力鹽切，平鹽，來。］
“镰1”的繁体字。亦作“鎌1”。
(1)镰刀。
(2)箭镞的棱角。
(3)有金属棱角的长武器。

鎌字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鎌； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1316第16
【廣韻】力鹽切【集韻】【韻會】離鹽切，?音廉。【說文】鍥也。【揚子·方言】刈鉤，自關而西或謂之鎌。【釋名】鎌，廉也，體廉薄也。其所刈稍稍取之。又似廉者也。【鮑照·東武吟】腰鎌刈葵藿。【韓愈·寄張十八助敎詩】晴雲如擘絮，新月似磨鐮。　又【揚子·方言】凡箭鏃，胡合嬴者四鐮。或曰拘膓。【註】四鐮，廣稜也。　又【揚子·方言】東齊，僞物謂之冉鎌。　【集韻】或作鐮。

鎌字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鎌字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lián］
["Guangyun" cut salt with force, flat salt, come. ]
Traditional characters for "鎌1". Also known as "Sickle 1".
(1) Sickle.
(2) The edges and corners of arrowheads.
(3) Long weapons with metal edges and corners.
sickle
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 sickle; Kangxi strokes: 18; page number: page 1316-16
[Guang Yun] Li Yan cuts [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Cuts away from salt, and the sound is clean. [Said Wen] Qiang Ye. 【Yangtze Dialect】Guan Hook, from the Guan to the west, or called the sickle. [Release name] sickle, cheap, and cheap. Take a little bit from the mowing. It is also like a cheap one. 【Bao Zhao·Dongwu Yin】The waist sickle and Kuihuo. [Han Yu·Send Zhang Eighteen Aid Poems] The clear clouds are like a flax, and the crescent moon is like a sickle.　[Yangtze Dialect] Where there is an arrow, the Huhe winner has four sickles. Or called Jusang. [Note] Four sickles, Guangling also.　[Yangtze Dialect] Eastern Qi, the fake thing is called Ran sickle.　【Jiyun】Or make sickle.

Name meaning

lián
вм. 镰
Radicals: 金, 兼  (gold, mona-lisa)
Meaning Mnemonic
You cast the Mona Lisa in gold and attach it to a stick to turn it into a sickle! It's really big and bulky, but when you swing it fast enough your new sickle cuts lots of wheat! Just don't tell anyone what you did with the famous Mona Lisa painting and you should be able to get away with this!
Imagine wielding your gold Mona Lisa sickle. It's sooo heavy, but it's really shiny and it cuts grass and wheat pretty well!
Reading Mnemonic
Now that you've turned the Mona Lisa into a sickle, you have to change the little description under its name in the Louvre. You draw a giant comma (かま) next to "Mona Lisa" and write "THE SICKLE." Then you shove it back on the wall as best you can.
Hear all the guests say, "Mona Lisa... comma the sickle? WHAT'S HAPPENED HERE?!" As panic ensues. You like your addition and you're very proud.
